entities.name: triwizard tournament
entities.description: The Triwizard Tournament is mentioned in the text as an event, but it's not clear what year or details about it. It's only mentioned in the title of the section.

entities.name: slytherin
entities.description: Slytherin is one of the four houses at Hogwarts School, described as 'shrewd' and valuing ambition. It's mentioned in the text that it loved those of great ambition.

entities.name: gryffindor
entities.description: Gryffindor is one of the four houses at Hogwarts School, described as valuing bravery. It's mentioned in the text that it prized the bravest students far beyond the rest.

entities.name: ravenclaw
entities.description: Ravenclaw is one of the four houses at Hogwarts School, described as valuing cleverness. It's mentioned in the text that it would always be the best for those who were the cleverest.

entities.name: hufflepuff
entities.description: Hufflepuff is one of the four houses at Hogwarts School, described as valuing hard work. It's mentioned in the text that it would be most worthy of admission for those who were hard workers.

entities.name: hogwarts school
entities.description: Hogwarts School is mentioned in the text as being founded by the four founders. It's described as a place where young sorcerers are educated.

relationships.description: Gryffindor is associated with the Triwizard Tournament, as it's mentioned that Gryffindor found a way to pick the worthy students for the tournament.
Slytherin was one of the four founders of Hogwarts School, as mentioned in the text.
Gryffindor was one of the four founders of Hogwarts School, as mentioned in the text.
Ravenclaw was one of the four founders of Hogwarts School, as mentioned in the text.
Hufflepuff was one of the four founders of Hogwarts School, as mentioned in the text.
